text: I feel like my relationships are based on deep love, or deep fear of being left alone.
I worry excessively about my partner leaving me or abandoning me.
I feel like I need constant reassurance from my partner to feel secure in the relationship.
I have difficulty trusting my partner and often suspect they might leave or cheat on me.
I feel like I'm too dependent on my partner and can't function well without them.
I engage in behaviors to prevent my partner from leaving, even if they're unhealthy or controlling.
I feel intense anxiety or panic when I think about being alone or single.
I have difficulty maintaining my own identity and interests outside of my relationship.
I feel like I'm in relationships primarily to avoid being alone, rather than for genuine connection.
I experience intense emotional reactions when my partner shows any sign of distance or disinterest.
I can maintain healthy independence and identity within my relationships.
I feel secure in my relationships and don't constantly worry about being abandoned.
I can trust my partner and don't need constant reassurance to feel secure.
I can be comfortable alone and don't feel like I need a relationship to be happy or complete.
I can maintain healthy boundaries and independence while still being close to my partner.
I feel like I'm in relationships because I'm afraid of being alone, not because of genuine love.
I have difficulty ending relationships, even when they're unhealthy, because I'm afraid of being alone.
I feel like my fear of abandonment drives my relationship behaviors more than love does.
I experience intense anxiety when I'm not in a relationship or when I think about being single.
I can form relationships based on genuine love and connection, not fear of being alone.
